unit_learning_outcomes.description: apply programming principles to the manipulation of audiovisual media and time-based creative works.
demonstrate information and technological literacies with contemporary computer-based audiovisual performance practices.
apply problem solving and technological skills, and design principles to realtime audio and visual creative works.
analyse how digital audio and visual media are represented, manipulated and controlled through software.

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to MCrInd or MMediaComm or MIC

assessments.description: A short original audiovisual performance involving realtime media interaction that demonstrates an understanding of unit content. Students are encouraged to work across media forms (incorporating both audio and video). Refer to iLearn for further information.
A brief outline of an original creative work that will be completed over the remainder of the unit. Refer to iLearn for further information.

A set of interactive problem-based exercises aimed at putting unit content into practice. The worksheets are open-book and are a means to give students both real-time and formative feedback. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is aimed at students interested in technologically mediated audio/visual performance practices and introduces a modular toolkit for sound, graphics, and interactivity.  Classes are practice-led, immersive and hands-on, offering students both a grounding in theoretical/conceptual approaches and practical instruction with one-on-one assistance for individual and collaborative interactive media performance projects.
data.title: Interactive Media

description: This unit is aimed at students interested in technologically mediated audio/visual performance practices and introduces a modular toolkit for sound, graphics, and interactivity.  Classes are practice-led, immersive and hands-on, offering students both a grounding in theoretical/conceptual approaches and practical instruction with one-on-one assistance for individual and collaborative interactive media performance projects.
title: Interactive Media
